element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm calculates the viewshed associated with a given point

element.name: METHOD
element.text: the method to use may be selected from the following: * Visibility: simply assign a value of 1 to the visible cells and 0 to those that are not visible. * Lighting: the value in each visible indicates the angle of vision. * Distance: the value in each visible cell indicates the distance between the emitter/receiver and the cell * Size: the value in each visible cell indicates the apparent size of the object in the cell, as seen from the emitter/receiver. This is a function of distance and angle.

element.name: POINT
element.text: Coordinates of the center point (the one that defines the viewshed)

element.name: HEIGHT
element.text: Height above ground of the emitter/receiver

element.name: HEIGHTOBS
element.text: Height above ground to add to each point except the central emitter/recever point

element.name: RADIUS
element.text: Maximum distance from emitter/receiver to be analyzed. If it is equal to zero, no maximum distance is considered.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The visibility layer. The meaning of values in this layer depends on the selected method.
